text: Julia Acker (1898â€“1942) was a Jewish-Polish artist. == Biography == Julia Acker was born in Lviv, Ukraine. She studied and worked there. Her first exhibition was in 1930. Later, she participated in some exhibitions in Lviv, Krakow, Poznan, Warsaw and Ivano-Frankivsk. She also had a personal exhibition in 1939. She painted flowers, still life and children's portraits. Julia Acker died of suicide in 1942. == References == Category:Polish artists Category:Artists who committed suicide Category:1898 births Category:1942 deaths Category:People from Lviv Category:20th-century artists
title: Julia Acker
